abstract.text: A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.

inlineContent.text: Matches provide a mechanism for a player to send both game and voice data to other players.
You never create a
object directly. Instead, GameKit passes a match object to a
method or a
handler when you set up a multiplayer game. For details, see
If you use the
class to find players, implement the
delegate method to set the match delegate. If you use the
class, set the match delegate in the handler you pass to the
method.
You can begin exchanging data when two or more players join the match. Implement the
delegate method to track when players connect or disconnect from the match. Then use either the
or the
method to send data. To process the data on the recipient side, implement the
delegate method.
To implement voice chat, use the
method to create one or more voice channels represented by the returned
object.
When you’re finished with a match, call the
method and set the match’s delegate to
. Otherwise, GameKit may send
to the delegate until all players disconnect from the match.

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An invitation to join a match sent to the local player from another player.
A protocol that handles invite events from Game Center.
A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.
The mechanism used to transmit data to other players.
Determines the best player in the game to act as the server for a client-server match.
Determines the best player in the game to act as the server for a client-server topology.
The delegate that handles communication between players in a match.
Disconnects the local player from the match.
The remaining number of players invited but not yet connected to the match.
The player identifiers for remote players in the match.
The properties for other players that matchmaking rules uses to find players, with some additions.
The players that join the match.
The local player’s properties that matchmaking rules used to find the players with some additions.
Creates a new match with the players from an existing match.
Transmits data to one or more players connected to the match.
Transmits data to a list of connected players.
Transmits data to all players connected to the match.
Joins the local player to a voice channel.
An object that receives connection status and data transmitted in a multiplayer game.
Processes the data sent from another player to the local player.
Handles when players connect or disconnect from a match.
A type for game-specific properties that Game Center uses to find players when using matchmaking rules.
An object that encapsulates the parameters to create a real-time or turn-based match.
An object that creates matches with other players without presenting an interface to the players.
Initiates a request to find players for a peer-to-peer match.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a real-time game and automatch to fill any empty slots.
An object that handles when the status of matchmaking changes.
Handles when the view controller finds players for a peer-to-peer match.
A voice channel that allows players to speak with each other in a multiplayer game.
Enable players to voice chat with all, or groups of, players in a multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Adding voice chat to multiplayer games

abstract.text: Set criteria for assigning players to teams in your game using matchmaking rules.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Assigning players to teams using rules

abstract.text: Develop games where multiple players interact in real time.
Send data between players in a real-time multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Exchanging data between players in real-time games

abstract.text: Discover and invite other players to participate in a real-time game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Finding multiple players for a game

abstract.text: Game Center applies different type of rules you create in a particular order to find the best matches.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
